DataElement.preferredName: Patient RAS Family Gene Mutation Personal Medical History Eligibility Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of whether a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study based on a history of RAS mutation-positive tumors.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient RAS Family Gene Mutation Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A family of genes that encode structurally similar small GTPases involved in a variety of signal transduction pathways. Mutation of genes in this family is associated with cancer._Any detectable and heritable change in the genetic material that causes a change in the GENOTYPE and which is transmitted to daughter cells and to succeeding generations._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: RAS Family Gene Mutation Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A family of genes that encode structurally similar small GTPases involved in a variety of signal transduction pathways. Mutation of genes in this family is associated with cancer.:Any detectable and heritable change in the genetic material that causes a change in the GENOTYPE and which is transmitted to daughter cells and to succeeding generations.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

Concepts.definition: A family of genes that encode structurally similar small GTPases involved in a variety of signal transduction pathways. Mutation of genes in this family is associated with cancer.
Any detectable and heritable change in the genetic material that causes a change in the GENOTYPE and which is transmitted to daughter cells and to succeeding generations.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion._A condition or state at a particular time.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Patients with history of RAS
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients with history of RAS mutation-positive tumors are not eligible regardless of interval from the current study
